page.title: 02CHIPPENHAM
page.content: The town of{Chippenham}is a stone built market town. It is a natural crossing point on the{River Avon. King Alfred lived here,and the manor of Chippenham was later held by Edward the Confessor. Today several stone fronted buildings remain from the 18th century. In the market place is the old town hall,a 15th century building bearing the borough arms. Chippenham is an{agricultural centre and an{industrial town.}The railway line and the{M4 motorway}mean that it is within easy reach of London and South Wales. The town is growing,with many new residential developments,especially on the Eastern side of the town along the A4 road towards Calne.
